Issues.Title: test(docs-infra): 404 for images during unit tests on Windows
Issues.Body:
Running the unit tests for aio on Windows, many 404s are logged for images, resulting in progress logs being spread over multiple lines:

```
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 0 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 1 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.304 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 2 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.355 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 3 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.395 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 4 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.438 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 5 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.471 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 6 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.504 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 7 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.542 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 8 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.578 secs)
Chrome 70.0.3538 (Linux 0.0.0): Executed 9 of 609 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.621 secs)
...
```

For example, running [this test](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/84be7c52dc431ab8621bc6231b8980a73072ae85/aio/src/app/app.component.spec.ts#L90-L92), I get:

```
WARN [web-server]: 404: /assets/images/logos/angular/logo-nav@2x.png
WARN [web-server]: 404: /assets/images/logos/angular/angular_whiteTransparent_withMargin.png
```

I was not able to reproduce it on a new project on Windows ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 
It also works fine on Linux and Windows Subsystem for Linux for `aio/` as well üòï
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "test(docs-infra): 404 for images during unit tests on Windows" (#29775)

Issues.Title: @angular/animations delay passed in options parameter for transition() call has no effect
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/animations ### Is this a regression? I don't know, I just tried to use the AnimationOptions parameter for the first time in @angular/animations version 7.2.1 ### Description I need to delay the starting of an animation, but the delay parameter of the animate() function doesn't fit, as the start event of the animation will be fired once the trigger was activated, regardless of the delay provided in this way: `animate ('duration delay easing')` In the [transition()](https://angular.io/api/animations/transition) and [AnimationOptions](https://angular.io/api/animations/AnimationOptions) docs I came across the delay property, which is supposed to "set a time-delay for initiating an animation action". I was not able to observe any delay when providing the `{ delay: '2s' }` as options parameter in my transition calls(). See stackblitz. I depend on this behaviour, as I need to update component state, based on the animation start event, which needs to fire after the delay. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qq6tyv ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.2.2
Node: 10.13.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.1

Issues.Title: angular 7.3 routing breaks IE9
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Tested with @angular/cli:7.3.8 ### Is this a regression? yes ### Description When starting an ng-project with routing enabled, the starter template is loaded only after opening the WebDevTools, but an unlimited amount of hashtags are added, resulting in a browser-crash. URL-Example: http://:4200/#/#/#/#/#/#/#/... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction (1a) (if you don't have an IE9 lying around) Download an IE9-Win7 image from https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/tools/vms/ (1b) You need to be able to access your host computer, so you might have to set the new VM to "network bridge" (2) install @angular/cli@7.3.8: `npm install -g @angular/cli@7.3.8` (3) start a new project with routing and SASS support: `ng new somefolder --defaults --routing` (4) serve the project: `cd somefolder; ng server --host 0.0.0.0 --disable-host-check` (5) open the project in IE9 on the VM on http://:4200/ --> nothing is shown (6) Open the WebDevTools via F12 and reload --> starter template is shown, but an unlimited number of hashtags are added (see above) and the browser crashed. ## üî• Exception or Error none, browser just crashed. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.3.8
Node: 10.15.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 
... 
Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.13.8
@angular-devkit/core         7.3.8
@angular-devkit/schematics   7.3.8
@schematics/angular          7.3.8
@schematics/update           0.13.8
rxjs                         6.3.3
typescript                   3.2.4
**Anything else relevant?** * affected version: IE9.0.8112.16421 * IE10 and IE11 have been tested and do *not* show this behavior * Behaviour can be reproduced on aot-build as well: `ng serve --host 0.0.0.0 --disable-host-check --aot` * `es5BrowserSupport` is set to true by default - but behaviour can be reproduced with `es5BrowserSupport: false` as well (see angular.json). But the first load shows up without having to open the webdevtools then.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "angular 7.3 routing breaks IE9" (#29761)

Issues.Title: Running Bazel build on Windows with default Execution Policy doesn't work
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package This issue is related to running Bazel on Windows. ### Is this a regression? N/A ### Description I checked out Angular and did a fresh yarn install. Once that was done, I tried running one of the `package/examples`, in this case it was my own example package (for my PR at https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/29755), which runs fine on the CI. Once I run my example using `yarn bazel run //packages/examples/router/activated-route:devserver`, I get the error I mentioned below. To resolve this, all I had to do was open PowerShell and execute the following command: ``` Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope CurrentUser -ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted ``` When I now try and run `yarn bazel run //packages/examples/router/activated-route:devserver`, everything works fine! :) As this unblocked me, I used this aproach and decided to see if anyone on twitter had a way to solve this. The friendly @alexeagle replied to my tweet asking if I had an Github issue. I didn't, but now I do üòÑ ! ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Just run the master on Windows 10 with the default Execution Policy (Resitricted) and run any example mini-app ( ensure to empty your bazel directory with cache etc). If you want to execute the command I've been pasting (`yarn bazel run //packages/examples/router/activated-route:devserver`), you'll need to run my branch for this PR: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/29755 ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Reactive form child ControlValueAccessor control's pristine is broken when parent group is disabled and reenabled
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/forms ### Description The issue I am observing is that the pristine property of a custom formControl component (containing a collection of formControls in a child formGroup) using CVA does not update under a specific scenario. The scenario being, if the parent formGroup that the custom control resides in, is disabled on ```ngOnInit``` and then later enabled with user interaction. The workaround I have used is to execute ```markAsPristine()``` when the parent formGroup is reset and when enabling based on the pristine value of the child formGroup. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - Create a parent class with a formGroup in a reactive form. - Attach a custom formControl using a CVA component to the formGroup. - In the parent class containing, disable the formGroup using ```formGroup.disable()``` - Add a button to enable the formGroup. - When the user clicks the button to enable the group, the child CVA component will show that that it is NOT pristine even though it has not been modified or touched. A working example to demonstrate the issue: * I have reactive form called "billing-info" with a parent formGroup called "netedForm". * I have a custom form control using CVA called "basic-info" that resided inside the "nestedForm" group. * Clicking on enable still shows the "basic-info" as NOT pristine. https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nested-forms-cva-z2ch7f ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.2.4
Node: 9.11.2
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.8

@angular/material                 7.3.7

**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: Lazy load modules based on variables in path
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->

_I hope_ this feature request is for the @angular/router


### Description

I don't know if this is already there in Angular, but I couldn't find any in the docs (or internet).

I think it's nice to have an option to specify routes like this:

`app-routing.module.ts`
```ts
import { Routes } from '@angular/router';

const routes: Routes = [
  {
    path: 'theme-builder/:themeId',
    loadChildren:
      'src/app/theme-builders/{{themeId}}-builder.module#BuilderModule'
  }
]
```

So that the angular can load the corresponding module. For large applications, sometimes we may not be able to specify every possible `loadChildren` paths. Sometimes these variables in the path are coming from a database - and it may also have a corresponding `loadChildren`. But specifying all these combinations hard-coded in the app doesn't feel like a scalable solution.

For clarity, the above code sample can be a replacement for:
```ts
const routes: Routes = [
  {
    path: 'theme-builder/theme-1',
    loadChildren:
      'src/app/theme-builders/theme-1-builder.module#BuilderModule'
  },
  {
    path: 'theme-builder/theme-2',
    loadChildren:
      'src/app/theme-builders/theme-2-builder.module#BuilderModule'
  },
  ...
]
```
### Describe the solution you'd like

I'm aware of the AOT. I think I can specify these individual lazy loaded modules in the `angular.josn` to compile them ahead of time.

```
{
  "architect":{
    "build":{
      "options":{
        "lazyModules": [
          "src/app/theme-builders/theme-1-builder.module",
          "src/app/theme-builders/theme-2-builder.module"
          ...
          // or even better a glob pattern
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}
```
### Describe alternatives you've considered

I came across this nice [article](https://netbasal.com/the-need-for-speed-lazy-load-non-routable-modules-in-angular-30c8f1c33093). But it seems to be more complex and doesn't support in-module-routing (I think).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Lazy load modules based on variables in path" (#29747)

Issues.Title: FormControlDirective and FormControlName contain incorrect or outdated deprecation statement
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... Doc for `FormControlDirective` and `FormControlName` contains incorrect or outdated deprecation statements: * Deprecation statement says support for using reactive form directives will be removed in v7. Was it removed? If so, this doc should simply say that reactive form directives are no longer supported. * Deprecation policy says this: "We support each deprecated API for at least two subsequent major releases, which means at least 12 months after deprecation." That means when deprecation is announced in v6, the earliest the feature can be removed/unsupported is v8. If this feature is not already removed/unsupported, will it be in v8? https://angular.io/guide/releases#deprecation-practices ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction `FormControlName` API reference https://angular.io/api/forms/FormControlName "Support for using the ngModel input property and ngModelChange event with reactive form directives has been deprecated in Angular v6 and will be removed in Angular v7." "To update your code before v7, you'll want to decide whether to stick with reactive form directives (and get/set values using reactive forms patterns) or switch over to template-driven directives." FormControlDirective API ref page https://angular.io/api/forms/FormControlDirective "Support for using the ngModel input property and ngModelChange event with reactive form directives has been deprecated in Angular v6 and will be removed in Angular v7." "To update your code before v7, you'll want to decide whether to stick with reactive form directives (and get/set values using reactive forms patterns) or switch over to template-driven directives." ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/... see above ### Reproduction Steps** see above ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** We need to confirm with @IgorMinar and then update docs to accurately describe the current state, for v7 and updated again if the current state will be different for v8. If we need to maintain the instructions for migrating code, I recommend positioning something like this: "Versions prior to v7/v8 [whatever version removes support] allowed the use of... That construct is no longer supported. To migrate your code..." ## üì∑Screenshot n/a ## üî• Exception or Error 



n/a
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info n/a ### Anything else relevant?

A clear and concise description of the problem... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction n/a ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/... https://angular.io/cli/update ### Reproduction Steps** n/a ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** There is nothing specific to v7 about the command below. Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| sass | dependencies | minor | [`1.17.4` -> `1.18.0`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/sass/1.17.4/1.18.0) | [source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>sass/dart-sass</summary>

### [`v1.18.0`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1180)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.17.4...1.18.0)

-   Avoid recursively listing directories when finding the canonical name of a
    file on case-insensitive filesystems.

-   Fix importing files relative to `package:`-imported files.

-   Don't claim that "package:" URLs aren't supported when they actually are.

##### Command-Line Interface

-   Add a `--no-charset` flag. If this flag is set, Sass will never emit a
    `@charset` declaration or a byte-order mark, even if the CSS file contains
    non-ASCII characters.

##### Dart API

-   Add a `charset` option to `compile()`, `compileString()`, `compileAsync()` and
    `compileStringAsync()`. If this option is set to `false`, Sass will never emit
    a `@charset` declaration or a byte-order mark, even if the CSS file contains
    non-ASCII characters.

-   Explicitly require that importers' `canonicalize()` methods be able to take
    paths relative to their outputs as valid inputs. This isn't considered a
    breaking change because the importer infrastructure already required this in
    practice.

</details>

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [x] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 0.12.4 ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... after upgrading to `@angular-devkit/build-angular@0.13.8`, ng e2e --prod stopped working. In angular/cli we setup budgets with `maximumWarning` and `maximumError`. When running `ng e2e --prod --port 4201` the budget errors out and the build/serve which should be triggered by `ng n2e` fails. Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... `ng build --sourceMap --watch` works. `ng build --project mylib --sourceMap --watch` does not work ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create an app `ng new myapp` (yes routing, SASS) 2. cd to the folder 3. Create a new library `ng generate library my-new-lib` 4. Run `ng build --sourceMap`, this works (I know this is default behavior, put it on false also works). 5. Run `ng build my-new-lib --sourceMap` 6. Get the error: `Unknown option: '--sourceMap' Also tried all of the similar commands that I know or found on the internet: `--source-map` `--vendor-source-map` `--vendorSourceMap` ## üî• Exception or Error

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request
Add 3 new commands to speed up and improve QOL for Angular projects and the Angular CLI by introducing ng move, ng rename and ng delete

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
I believe that Angular should have a dedicated set of commands for Moving components, modules and services as well as Renaming and Deleting them right from the CLI.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
I propose the solutions to the three new commands should look like:

ng move [ng mv] currentPathofFolderFile newPathofFolderFile
ng rename [ng rn] oldFolderFileName newFolderFileName
ng delete [ng del] folderFileName

Doing these commands should update the path references for the components/modules/services and of course do the intended action.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
There are a couple VSCode extensions that sort of do this, the most popular being MoveTS but that doesnt update the file paths for angulars needs and ends up making the build fail as it uses the wrong path type.  

Also not everyone who works with Angular uses VSCode as their IDE so they dont have the option for MoveTS like extensions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Move, Rename, Delete" (#14081)

Issues.Title: buildOptimizer deleted some code from a property setter in a component that came from an ng-packagr library
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Unknown. ### Description The build optimizer seems to have stripped out some important code. Here's my original TypeScript (template and styles ommitted for brevity): ``` export interface IExpandable { isExpanded: boolean; isExpandedChange: EventEmitter; canExpand: boolean; toggleExpand(): void; expand(); collapse(); } @Component({ selector: 'atlas-expandable-if', template: ` ... `, styles: [` ... `] }) export class ExpandableIfComponent implements IExpandable { @Input() preserveSpaceForIcon: boolean = true; @Input() canExpand: boolean = true; @Input() expandIcon: string; @Input() collapseIcon: string; @Input() loadingIcon: string; @Input() delayedExpand = false; @Input() overrideIcon: string|false = false; @Output() isExpandedChange: EventEmitter = new EventEmitter(); isExpanding = false; constructor(public icons: AtlasIconPaths, private changeDetector: ChangeDetectorRef) { } private _isExpanded = false; get isExpanded(): boolean { return this._isExpanded; } @Input() set isExpanded(value: boolean) { if (this._isExpanded !== value) { this._isExpanded = value; this.isExpandedChange.emit(value); this.changeDetector.markForCheck(); } } clickHeader(event: MouseEvent) { if (!event.shiftKey) { event.preventDefault(); event.stopPropagation(); this.toggleExpand(); } } toggleExpand() { if (this.isExpanding) { return; } if (this.isExpanded || this.canExpand) { if (this.isExpanded) { this.collapse(); } else { this.expand(); } } } expand() { if (this.delayedExpand) { this.isExpanding = true; setTimeout(() => { this.isExpanding = false; this.isExpanded = true; }); this.changeDetector.markForCheck(); } else { this.isExpanded = true; } } collapse() { this.isExpanded = false; } } ``` And here's the code that gets generated with `buildOptimizer: true` (un-minified, but otherwise presented as-is): **Notice the `set isExpanded` property setter** ``` sa = class { constructor(e, t) { this.icons = e, this.changeDetector = t, this.preserveSpaceForIcon = !0, this.canExpand = !0, this.delayedExpand = !1, this.overrideIcon = !1, this.isExpandedChange = new it, this.isExpanding = !1, this._isExpanded = !1 } get isExpanded() { return this._isExpanded } set isExpanded(e) { this._isExpanded !== e && (this._isExpanded = e) } clickHeader(e) { e.shiftKey || (e.preventDefault(), e.stopPropagation(), this.toggleExpand()) } toggleExpand() { this.isExpanding || (this.isExpanded || this.canExpand) && (this.isExpanded ? this.collapse() : this.expand()) } expand() { this.delayedExpand ? (this.isExpanding = !0, setTimeout(() => { this.isExpanding = !1, this.isExpanded = !0 }), this.changeDetector.markForCheck()) : this.isExpanded = !0 } collapse() { this.isExpanded = !1 } }, ``` This code is in a library that gets packaged via `ng-packagr` version 5.0.1. However, here is the code that `ng-packagr` generates: ``` let ExpandableIfComponent = class ExpandableIfComponent { constructor(icons, changeDetector) { this.icons = icons; this.changeDetector = changeDetector; this.preserveSpaceForIcon = true; this.canExpand = true; this.delayedExpand = false; this.overrideIcon = false; this.isExpandedChange = new EventEmitter(); this.isExpanding = false; this._isExpanded = false; } get isExpanded() { return this._isExpanded; } set isExpanded(value) { if (this._isExpanded !== value) { this._isExpanded = value; this.isExpandedChange.emit(value); this.changeDetector.markForCheck(); } } clickHeader(event) { if (!event.shiftKey) { event.preventDefault(); event.stopPropagation(); this.toggleExpand(); } } toggleExpand() { if (this.isExpanding) { return; } if (this.isExpanded || this.canExpand) { if (this.isExpanded) { this.collapse(); } else { this.expand(); } } } expand() { if (this.delayedExpand) { this.isExpanding = true; setTimeout(() => { this.isExpanding = false; this.isExpanded = true; }); this.changeDetector.markForCheck(); } else { this.isExpanded = true; } } collapse() { this.isExpanded = false; } }; __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", Boolean) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "preserveSpaceForIcon", void 0); __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", Boolean) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "canExpand", void 0); __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", String) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "expandIcon", void 0); __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", String) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "collapseIcon", void 0); __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", String) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "loadingIcon", void 0); __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", Object) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "delayedExpand", void 0); __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", Object) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "overrideIcon", void 0); __decorate([ Output(), __metadata("design:type", EventEmitter) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "isExpandedChange", void 0); __decorate([ Input(), __metadata("design:type", Boolean), __metadata("design:paramtypes", [Boolean]) ], ExpandableIfComponent.prototype, "isExpanded", null); ExpandableIfComponent = __decorate([ Component({ selector: 'atlas-expandable-if', template: ` ... styles: [` ... `] }), __metadata("design:paramtypes", [AtlasIconPaths, ChangeDetectorRef]) ], ExpandableIfComponent); ``` The correct code is generated if `buildOptimizer: false` is used in my `angular.json`. ## üåç Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 7.3.7
Node: 11.12.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, elements
... forms, http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.7
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.7
@angular/cli                      7.3.7
@ngtools/json-schema              1.1.0
@schematics/angular               7.3.7
@schematics/update                0.13.7
ng-packagr                        5.0.1
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.6

Issues.Title: Wrong position of MatSelect options if body element set min-with
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Bug #### What is the expected behavior? Use mat-select and show options dialog in correct position. ![screenshot-stackblitz com-2019 04 09-13-11-39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20199118/55774739-0debe300-5ac9-11e9-9c25-73f7abf6b053.png) #### What is the current behavior? If the parent element like body set min-with and resize the browser small than min-width. Then options dialog show in incorrect position as below ![screenshot-stackblitz com-2019 04 09-13-05-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20199118/55774697-d9782700-5ac8-11e9-99af-32cb0c34f0bf.png) But if scroll horizontal to let mat-select element close the edge of browser, it will show options dialog correctly. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
add css into style.css as below `body{ min-width: 50rem; } mat-form-field{ width: 100%; }` full demo https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-uxyhei?file=styles.css #### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? Angular: 7.2.8 Material: 7.3.3 typescript: 3.2.4 #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Wrong position of MatSelect options if body element set min-with" (#15764)

Issues.Title: Custom header name in Table with expandable rows
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Using the [exemple](https://run.stackblitz.com/api/angular/v1?file=app%2Ftable-expandable-rows-example.ts) provided in docs, I realized that is not possible customize the header string, being the same name of the variable `columnsToDisplay`.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Being able to render a custom text in the header and not necessarily the `columnsToDisplay` array strings, which relates to `ELEMENT_DATA` fields 

#### Is there anything else we should know?

No.

Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Custom header name in Table with expandable rows" (#15763)

Issues.Title: refactor(progress-spinner): breaking constructor changes for 8.0
Issues.Body:
Handles the breaking constructor changes for `MatProgressSpinner` and `MatSpinner`. Also takes the chance to remove some unnecessary private properties.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* The `animationMode` mode parameter is now required in the `MatProgressSpinner` and `MatSpinner` constructors.
* The `_elementRef` parameter has changed from `ElementRef<any>` to `ElementRef<HTMLElement>` in the `MatProgressSpinner` and `MatSpinner` constructors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(progress-spinner): breaking constructor changes for 8.0" (#15761)

Issues.Title: docs(theme): add example of theming elements based on CSS selector
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
As mentioned in https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/4344#issuecomment-298376011:
> You can create alternate themes scoped to whatever arbitrary selector you like, and then apply that select to whichever subsection of your app fits your needs.

An example was also posted in https://github.com/angular/material/pull/11690#discussion_r272299321.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
This isn't covered in https://material.angular.io/guide/theming and while it may be trivial to some Sass experts, it is not obvious to many developers who aren't as experienced with Sass or Angular Material.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs(theme): add example of theming elements based on CSS selector" (#15760)

Issues.Title: Cannot Print Overlay in IE 11 with BlockScrollStrategy
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

In modern browsers (e.g. Chrome, Firefox, and Safari), when using an Overlay with `BlockScrollStrategy` and printing the page (via `window.print` or just `ctrl-p`), the overlay will appear in front of the `body` content as expected.

#### What is the current behavior?

In IE 11, the overlay does not appear on the printed page when `BlockScrollStrategy` is used.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

This stackblitz illustrates the issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/scroll-strategy-block-eh5hrg

Printing the page in a modern browser works as expected, but in IE the overlay will not appear on the printed page.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cannot Print Overlay in IE 11 with BlockScrollStrategy" (#15759)

Issues.Title: refactor(badge): breaking constructor changes for 8.0
Issues.Body:
Handles the breaking changes in the badge constructor for 8.0.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `_document` parameter has been removed and the `_renderer` parameter is now required in the `MatBadge` constructor.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(badge): breaking constructor changes for 8.0" (#15758)

Issues.Title: _element should not be private in MatSelectionList
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

need access to _element: ElementRef of MatSelectionList but it's currently private.
i need to scroll MatSelectionList to the top by accessing the element.scrollTop

#### What is the current behavior?

can't get access to _element because it's private.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

My use case is I have dynamically added an item to the list, and it's at the top.  but the user could be looking at the bottom of the list.  i need to scroll the list to the top at that time.  it would be really easy if i could have access to the ElementRef.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

7.3.5

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I think it is not harmful to allow access to the ElementRef.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "_element should not be private in MatSelectionList" (#15756)

Issues.Title: feat: run v8 migration schematics for v8 beta and rc releases
Issues.Body:
Currently the V8 schematic migrations only run for `8.0.0` which does not
include any betas or release candidates. We want to run the schematic in
the beta's and RC in order to get early feedback about the schematics. Enabling
it promptly with V8 stable release can result in accidental breakages that we would
like to fix/identify before.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat: run v8 migration schematics for v8 beta and rc releases" (#15753)

Issues.Title: feat(paginator): add optional page numbers (#2)
Issues.Body:
Add optional page numbers for displaying navigation on paginator.
Number of visible pages defaults to 3, and is configurable.
Even numbers are rounded up to odd numbers to display equal number
of pages on each side of the current selected page.

Issues.Title: mat-select not working after refresh page
Issues.Body:
Hello,
I've spotted strange issue with only mat-select (maybe with other compoments too, idk)..

I can't open dropdown - overlay does not appear and the normal click event is dispatched instead of material open with e.preventDefault. 
To check this behavior I use (click) handler to log event.

- If works - no event log (e.preventDefault called, select overlay opened normally) 
- If it doesn't - click event logged - any change on UI

Here is animation for this issue: 

![image](https://i.imgur.com/9ZcCvb0.gif)

Here is repo for all files prepared to reproduce this error: https://github.com/wojtek1150/mat-select-error

What I've discovered is that problem is appearing when I use auth guard with lazy loading modules. So maybe this bug is connected with ngrx somehow. Also in that repo I've used multi-application flow, but for me it looks fine.

Maybe someone spotted this once and have solution or whatever what can help will be very usefull for me'cause I spend last 3 days for debbuging this and I have nothing :(
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select not working after refresh page" (#15752)

Issues.Title: mat-icon: To be able to have both svgIcon and fontIcon
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Let's say you have a js structure (an array of object) holding a list of icons, some svg, some font with other properties.
In your view you want to have a simple *ngFor to iterate on all your icons.
For svg icons, your object will have a "svg" property.
For font icons, your object will have a "font" property.
The key will be undefined if not set.
Therefore, you will have in your loop something like:
`<mat-icon [matTooltip]="btn.tooltip | translate" [svgIcon]="btn.svgicon">{{ btn.icon }}</mat-icon>`
Sounds pretty easy but that's not working right now (Angular Material 7.3.7).

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
To simply KISS
To avoid a fugly:
`<mat-icon *ngIf="btn.svgicon" [matTooltip]="btn.tooltip | translate" [svgIcon]="btn.svgicon"></mat-icon>`
`<mat-icon *ngIf="!btn.svgicon" [matTooltip]="btn.tooltip | translate">{{ btn.icon }}</mat-icon>`


#### Is there anything else we should know?
For what I saw, the reason about that is located in:
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/lib/icon/icon.ts#L224-L244

A quick hack could be :
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/lib/icon/icon.ts#L237
`!this._usingFontIcon() && this._clearSvgElement();`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-icon: To be able to have both svgIcon and fontIcon" (#15751)

Issues.Title: CDK Drag and Drop cdkDragBoundary is not working after resize in responsive design
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The Drag element should be dragged inside cdkDragBoundary boundary even after resize the browser window. 

#### What is the current behavior?
Dragging area is less than cdkDragBoundary boundary

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://dragndrop-restrction.stackblitz.io/

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7
CDK 7
Windows 10
TypeScript 3.1
IE11, Edge, Chrome 73, Firefox 66


#### Is there anything else we should know?
The dragged item is responsive so it will change as per browser size
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CDK Drag and Drop cdkDragBoundary is not working after resize in responsive design" (#15749)

Issues.Title: Angular material Table - keyvalue pair mapping
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? I would like to have a very generic solution where I pass a key value object like { name: 'abc' , age : 32 } . Would like to map this data to the table . So when ever the new values are added in the object (like we might add address : 'abc' , without any code change would like the table to render this data. Columns name can be static like "key" "value" . I am referring to the behavior we have in angular - keyValue which will map the key and value accordingly #### What is the current behavior? #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? All are latest versions #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular material Table - keyvalue pair mapping " (#15748)

Issues.Title: Table with sticky columns scroll should start after sticky column
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? When a particular column or row is sticky, the scroll should start after the sticky element since it doesn't move. ![edited](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29203844/55679613-37bbd300-592c-11e9-803e-596b79e3b652.jpeg) #### What is the current behavior? When a sticky directive is applied the scroll starts from the place where sticky is applied even though it doesn't move. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Please refer the stackblitz example. Here i have made first column and first row as sticky
Table with sticky row and column: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tdaevu
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? Material : 7.1.0 Angular: 7.1.0 Typescript: 3.1.6 Browsers: Chrome OS: Ubuntu 16.04 #### Is there anything else we should know? I have not been able to get workaround currently. Cheers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Table with sticky columns scroll should start after sticky column" (#15747)

Issues.Title: fix(input): label floating state not updated when using text binding inside textarea
Issues.Body:
Fixes the state that tells the form field whether the label should float not being up-to-date if the consumer is using a `textarea` with a text binding (e.g. `<textarea matInput>{{someValue}}</textarea>`). This causes a "changed after checked" error with regular change detection and the label to be hidden incorrectly with `OnPush` change detection.

Fixes #12070.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(input): label floating state not updated when using text binding inside textarea" (#15745)

Issues.Title: refactor: remove mixin classes from public api
Issues.Body: Removes the base classes that are being used to apply mixins from the public API. These classes can't really be consumed outside of Material and exposing them bloats up the public API.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: remove mixin classes from public api" (#15743)

Issues.Title: Hide "dd.mm.yyyy" on form-field with empty date-input
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Date-Input behaves like all other form-fields when the value is empty and the label is used as its placeholder. When clicked inside the field the format-placeholder should be shown.

#### What is the current behavior?
Even without any value (or clicking inside it) the form-field label is floating above the input-field and it shows the local format-placeholder 'dd.mm.yyyy'.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-form-date-behavior

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
not sure
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hide "dd.mm.yyyy" on form-field with empty date-input" (#15742)

Issues.Title: feat(radio): support theme color on mat-radio-group
Issues.Body:
Adds support for setting the color of the entire `mat-radio-group`, rather than having to set it on each button individually.

Fixes #15701.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(radio): support theme color on mat-radio-group" (#15741)

Issues.Title: cdkVirtualFor doesn't render new async emitted items
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When a new array is emitted from the `BehaviorSubject`, the new items should be rendered in the list.

#### What is the current behavior?
Although new items are emitted from the `BehaviorSubject` in the form of a new array, the items are not rendered. 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Scrolling down to the bottom of the list causes the `BehaviorSubject` to emit new values. These values are never rendered.
https://stackblitz.com/edit/material-infinite-calendar

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.2.11
Material 7.3.6

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I've posted a SO question here -> https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55369253/cdkvirtualfor-not-rendering-new-items

Because this is a core feature of `cdkVirtualFor`, I'm sure the solution has more to do with the way I'm attempting to _use_ it that there being something wrong with the implementation. That being said, I've been frustrated by this off and on for over a week and I need someone to tell me why it doesn't work the way I think it should.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "cdkVirtualFor doesn't render new async emitted items" (#15736)

Issues.Title: refactor(tabs): constructor breaking changes for 8.0
Issues.Body:
Handles the constructor-related breaking changes for 8.0.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `_ngZone` and `_platform` parameters in `MatTabHeader` constructor are now required.
* `changeDetectorRef` parameter in `MatTabBody` constructor is now required.

Issues.Title: Hover color for dark themes too light
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Hover background color on dark themes shouldn't be the same as text color

#### What is the current behavior?
With hover background color and text color cannot be discerned.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
You can check the table example here https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hover color for dark themes too light" (#15735)
